document_title: Correction to: Succession and persistence of microbial communities and antimicrobial resistance genes associated with International Space Station environmental surfaces
summary_full: This document is a correction to a previously published article in Microbiome (2018) 6:204. The correction addresses a typographic error in the scientific notation for the number of sequencing reads. The corrected text clarifies that approximately 7.3 × 10^8 reads associated with microorganisms were generated after quality trimming from both PMA and non-PMA treated samples. All metagenomic reads were normalized to a total of 3.1 × 10^8, with 7.4 × 10^6 assigned to each sample, and this normalization did not affect the taxonomic diversity. The authors apologize for the error.
key_findings: A typographic error in the number of sequencing reads has been corrected.
The corrected text specifies approximately 7.3 × 10^8 microbial reads were generated.
Normalized metagenomic reads totaled 3.1 × 10^8, with 7.4 × 10^6 per sample.
The read normalization did not impact taxonomic diversity.
related_papers: Succession and persistence of microbial communities and antimicrobial resistance genes associated with International Space Station environmental surfaces. Microbiome. 2018;6:204. doi: 10.1186/s40168-018-0585-2.
conclusions: The correction clarifies a specific data point regarding sequencing read counts, ensuring accuracy in the reported microbial community analysis from ISS environmental surfaces.
impact_statement: This correction ensures the accurate reporting of microbial sequencing data from the International Space Station, crucial for understanding microbial persistence and resistance gene dynamics in space environments.
